text: hi everyone fast any fast Tano here are
the internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for a classic review of Sade's
Diamond life this is the debut 1984
album from British vocalist and
songwriter Sade who cut her teeth on the
English music scene in the 80s as a
backup singer originally before forming
a collaborative partnership with
multi-instrumentalist and songwriter
Stuart matthewman this creative
relationship would not only serve as the
foundation for Sade's debut album but
matthewman would go on to bring major
songwriting contributions to every
record shade would release past this
point even 2010 Soldier of Love
listening to Diamond life it's not hard
to see why the record would appeal in
1984 especially since it's still so
widely appealing today among fans of Pop
R B and Seoul in those fields at the
time Sade's voice and style would be a
breath of fresh air as we're talking
about the mid-80s and while yes a lot of
great stuff was dropping in those Styles
prevailing Trends instrumentation and
Aesthetics across the board in music
were louder were more synthesized and
more rigid than ever I mean Thriller was
a few years deep into setting such a
maximal tone for pop and R B and
Madonna's Like a Virgin was just months
away from hitting the airwaves for the
first time but Shady's Diamond Life
couldn't be less interested in the pomp
that defined much of the 80s This Record
was more on a mission to deliver the
smoothest and most modern take on Seoul
possible for the time period something I
wouldn't say she was alone in at the
time per se smoother strains of Soul
music were wildly popular throughout the
70s Marvin Gaye himself even dropped
midnight love which of course featured
Sexual Healing just a few years earlier
but Sade's approach especially on
diamond life was much more meditative it
was subtler it was jazzier than many of
her contemporaries at the time these
would go on to be defining
characteristics for much of her catalog
from here as well so if you enjoy this
record you're probably going to like her
next several too however I would say
diamond life is a great place to start
due to its organic Ambiance its strong
songwriting in pristine production the
beauty of this record is simple it's
uncomplicated and really consistent too
as many of the songs on this record stir
up a similarly passionate and sensual
energy that's reinforced from track to
track to track starting with The Groovy
exotic and classy Smooth Operator which
hits with not only some cute little drum
Loops right off the bat but also some
tasteful sacks and electric piano keys
shade's spoken word vocals and dynamic
singing voice show a level of class and
Poise that is just stunning plus a
sophistication I think more cerebral
listeners will pick up on right away I
love her volume and breath control on
this record the way she sings reminds me
of a really skilled horn player even the
way she articulates her lyrics Just
oozes style especially as on this song
she describes this very in-demand lover
boy who's moving from girl to girl
perfectly soundtracked by bold chord
changes on the chorus and slowly
intensifying grooves and sax
embellishments things somehow get
smoother and catchier on the track your
love is king with a lot of Soulful chord
changes and Grand Harmony layers plus
some meditative grooves to boot these
all underscore Sade singing with a deep
longing in her voice about a love that
trumps all others the following hang on
to your love turns up the heat and
urgency with one of the more driving
grooves and bass lines on the entire
record there are some really moody and
nocturnal hits of rhythm guitar on this
one too the lyrics on this one come from
a place of confusion but also motivation
as shade sings about being taken aback
by the difficulties of love and an
inconsistent partner asking why do you
play these games and why are you walking
away these questions are eventually
given answers or at least prescriptions
be brave when the journey is rough love
isn't easy don't give up she kind of
serves as a musical love coach on this
one or at least maybe a love philosopher
a role she plays into pretty effectively
once again on the following track
Frankie's first Affair I think you guys
can put two and two together on the
messaging and the story of the song if
you listen to it but what really brings
this track home for me is the pain in
shade's voice during certain passages of
the track it seems like she might have
more of a personal brush with the
goings-on in the song then you might
assume given that she's just trying to
make herself like a referee in the
situation when am I going to make a
living is a meditation on the everyday
economic struggles of average people the
Baseline hand drums and bright group
vocals on the track sound like something
out of the smooth Soul strains of the
mid 70s one could even say the song is a
sort of akin to Marvin Gaye who we
mentioned earlier but yeah that one is
passionate and well written too well
performed as well then cherry pie may be
the funkiest and darkest cut on the
entire LP the Bittersweet atmosphere and
Aura surrounding this one is amazing as
lyrically Sade sings about expelling
this Heartbreaker from her life then
Sally is a very sad hard-hitting and
just another spectacular example of
Storytelling on the lp as we hear this
story of a protagonist who keeps all of
the very sad lonely and broken men
described in the lyrics company it's a
song given your perspective can be read
a number of different ways but what is
clear is that Sade does Express quite a
bit of sympathy for uh this character's
burden that she's putting on herself
dealing with these guys the fiery jazz
piano and sax work throughout the track
only reinforce the sultry energy and
painful loneliness radiating off the
track too the sweet and endearing I will
be your friend easily has the most
feel-good and sing-along chorus on the
entire LP uh will be your friend then
the closing track is a very chill and
meditative take on the track why can't
we live together which not only helps
end the album off on a positive note but
also shows the love shade sings about on
this record isn't just reserved for
romantic interests it's also about the
world around her as well yeah really
fantastic and pretty much Flawless batch
of tracks on this record this thing is a
stunning smooth spotless and gorgeous
Soul record with a lot of GrooVe passion
and sensuality fantastic lyricism and
singing as well and it's abs absolutely
positively a classic and you should
listen to it thank you okay okay okay
okay transition have you given this
album a listen did you love it did you
hate it what would you rate it you're
the best you're the best what should I
review next hit the like if you like
Please Subscribe and please don't cry
hit the Bell as well over here next to
my head is another video that you can

subscribe to the channel Anthony fantano
Sade forever
